run(refresh=True)¶

Running task training, then evaluate adversaries in three sensitive attributes (gender, age, occupation)

Parameters

refresh (bool, optional) – whether to re-initialize model for each sensitive attribute, defaults to True

train_task_with_adversary(mode: str, dirname: str, refresh=True, progress=None, task=None, adv_tasks=[])¶

Train a task, then evaluate adversary performance

Parameters

  • mode (str) – sensitive attribute to evaluate (one of age, occupation and gender)

  • dirname (str) – directory to store model checkpoints

  • refresh (bool, optional) – whether to re-initialize model for each sensitive attribute, defaults to True

  • progress (rich.progress.Progress, optional) – progress bar instance, defaults to None

  • task (rich.progress.TaskID, optional) – task instance, defaults to None

  • adv_tasks (list, optional) – list of adversaries to test, defaults to []

class models.GNN(embed: int, gnn_layers: int, gnn_type: str, device: Union[str, torch.device])¶

Multi-layer Graph Neural Network supporting various neighborhood aggregation methods

Parameters

  • embed (int) – embedding dimension

  • gnn_layers (int) – number of GNN layers

  • gnn_type (str) – type of GNN

  • device (Union[str, torch.device]) – deivce to run the neural network

Raises

NotImplementedError – GNN type not recognized

class models.SharedBilinearDecoder(num_relations: int, num_weights: int, embed_dim: int, args: argparse.Namespace)¶

Decoder where the relationship score is given by a bilinear form between the embeddings (i.e., one learned matrix per relationship type). Modified from https://github.com/joeybose/Flexible-Fairness-Constraints

Parameters

  • num_relations (int) – number of relations to predict

  • num_weights (int) – number of base weights

  • embed_dim (int) – embedding dimension

  • args (argparse.Namespace) – namespace for input parameters

forward(embeds1: torch.FloatTensor, embeds2: torch.FloatTensor, rels: torch.FloatTensor) → Tuple[torch.FloatTensor, torch.FloatTensor]¶

Predict scoring by weighted sum of score probabilities and score as well as computing the NLL loss.

Parameters

  • embeds1 (torch.FloatTensor) – the first embedding in biliear form

  • embeds2 (torch.FloatTensor) – the second embedding in biliear form

  • rels (torch.FloatTensor) – All relationships

Returns

tuple of loss and predicted score

Return type

Tuple[torch.FloatTensor,torch.FloatTensor]

predict(embeds1: torch.FloatTensor, embeds2: torch.FloatTensor) → torch.FloatTensor¶

Predict scoring by weighted sum of score probabilities and score.

Parameters

  • embeds1 (torch.FloatTensor) – the first embedding in biliear form

  • embeds2 (torch.FloatTensor) – the second embedding in biliear form

Returns

class models.SimpleGCMC(decoder: torch.nn.modules.module.Module, embed_dim: int, num_ent: int, encoder=None)¶

Naive GCMC Encoder-Decoder architecture, as specified in https://arxiv.org/pdf/1706.02263.pdf

Parameters

  • decoder (torch.nn.Module) – decoder, usually SharedBilinearDecoder

  • embed_dim (int) – embedding dimension

  • num_ent (int) – number of entities

  • encoder (torch.nn.Module, optional) – encoder neural network, if not using default embedding, defaults to None

class models.GAL_Nhop(decoder, embed_dim, num_ent, edges, args, encoder=None, hop=2)¶

Information Obfuscation, N-Hop Level

Parameters

  • decoder (torch.nn.Module) – decoder neural network

  • embed_dim (int) – embedding dimension

  • num_ent (int) – number of entities

  • edges (torch.LongTensor) – edge tensor

  • args (argparse.Namespace) – namespace for input arguments

  • hop (int, defaults to 2) – number of hops to probabilistically sample

  • encoder (torch.nn.Module, optional) – encoder neural network, if not using default embedding, defaults to None

forward_attr(user_features)¶

Routine that implements probabilistic n-hop algorithm proposed in our paper. Intuitively, this algorithm greedily constructs a path of length n by uniformly picking a neighbor from the current end of the path and checking if the node has existed previously in the path, avoiding formation of cycles. Worst-case running time of this algorithm is O(n^2), because in each step of the main loop, the algorithm performs O(n) checks in the worst case scenario

helper.gcmc.test_gcmc(dataset, args, model, progress=None, task=None)¶

Testing routine for GCMC, Graph Convolutional Matrix Completion (https://arxiv.org/abs/1706.02263v2)

Parameters

  • dataset (torch.utils.data.Dataset) – Testing dataset for GCMC

  • args (argparse.Namespace) – namespace for input parameters

  • model (torch.nn.Module) – task model

  • progress (None, optional) – _unused, defaults to None

  • task (None, optional) – _unused

Returns

tuple for testing metrics and pandas dataframe confusion matrix

Return type

Tuple[Dict[str, float], pd.DataFrame]

helper.gradient_descent_ascent.train_gda(data_loader, adv_loader, args, model, optimizer_task, optimizer_adv, pretrain=False, progress=None, task=None)¶

Training routine for Gradient Descent-Ascent, main algorithm proposed in our work.

Parameters

  • data_loader (torch.utils.data.DataLoader) – Data loader for main task

  • adv_loader (torch.utils.data.DataLoader) – Data loader for adversarial defense

  • args (argparse.Namespace) – namespace for input parameters

  • model (torch.nn.Module) – task model

  • optimizer (torch.optim.Optimizer) – optimizer for task, having access to GNN and task decoder

  • optimizer_adv (torch.optim.Optimizer) – optimizer for gradient descent, having access to GNN, Gradient Reversal Layer and simulated oracle adversary

  • pretrain (bool, optional) – whether to pretrain task without the defense pass

  • progress (None, optional) – _unused

  • task (None, optional) – _unused
